review_title: OK service for patients; really terrible place to work unless you are one of the top corporate folks in the company.
pros: Loved working with the patients and some of the office staff.
cons: There is a strong fear of educated, intelligent, outspoken employees. There is ZERO clinical leadership at the clinic level. Every decision has to be driven through the top four or five people running the company.  There is no effort made to be inclusive of different interests, backgrounds, or skill sets. People are forced to seek care there given there are no true alternatives, and so therapists are forced to see 8-12 people a DAY in a seven hour work day. Raises are small and not proportionate with the workload. Therapists are given tremendous responsibility and work with no leadership or solidarity from the four or five people who run everything. The outlying clinics in Eastern TN are managed by people who are not clinically trained and therefore, driven by characterological flaws and temperamental outbursts.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Knoxville, TN
pros: Monday through Friday, Holidays paid off
cons: Make you work more than they will pay you

review_title: Patients and Employees deserve so much better!
pros: Their mission to serve the uninsured, underinsured, low-income, and indigent population is why I joined Cherokee, however, they’ve lost focus of that mission.
cons: Cherokee has a very high turnover rate because they (upper management) do not value their employees. The pay is poor and communication is even worse. Their focus is quantity over quality and their patients are paying the price with their health. They cannot keep good employees, nor do they try to keep them. They recently initiated an incentive program for their current employees to recruit folks, but what they need to have is an incentive program to retain their current employees. I wouldn’t recruit anyone to work for Cherokee. The COO and CEO are completely disconnected from their employees and instead of trying to communicate to improve morale and the work environment, they just have a new hiring class every 2 weeks to replace their good employees who continue to leave. My heart hurts for their patients as there is no quality care or continuity of care.

review_title: Not the best place to work
pros: I truly did enjoy the people that I got to meet at all of the Cherokee locations. There are some great individuals that work for the company and the mission is great in terms of how they are catering to those less fortunate than most in the area.
cons:
-There is a fundamental disconnect between upper management and employees
-Salary is MUCH worse than other places in the area; probably due to the fact that CHS is a non profit organization
-There is a lack of any compensation for hours worked over 40. You are expected to work this overtime and not complain when you aren't compensated. There has to be a solution here.
-Constant turnover indicates that there is a huge problem with Cherokee Health Systems. Retaining employees should not be that hard.
-There is no room for advancement - at least not in the IT department. There is no way to receive constructive criticism. I believe that might have changed, but how effective will it be? 
-Management just seems to only care about their echelon and not about employees. You WILL do what they want, no matter how it affects you.

review_title: It could be so much better.
pros: Co-workers were super nice and helpful. The Alcoa VP was awesome. I loved so many of the clients that I worked with and thought that it was a great clinical experience in terms of my professional development.
cons: Central management doesn't understand how they add to the overall healthcare problem by burning out providers and providing inconsistent care to the patients served bc the therapists are frequently turning over.

review_title: I liked it but not much growth.
pros: I liked most of my coworkers there.  The benefits were good.  It was a good experience. Working with patients was great.  Great learning experience and my direct supervisor was awesome.
cons: Low pay and tiny raise.  They laid people off very inconsiderate. No growth.  No seniority.  It was shocking how it ended and they offered no severance package.

pros: Our philosophy is simple, we believe the best approach to wellness involves treating both the body and mind. That's why we offer an array of comprehensive primary care, behavioral health, and prevention programs and services. Whether you need medical, dental or behavioral health care, our compassionate, dedicated staff is here to help you.
cons: We accept most insurance and TennCare plans and offer flexible payment schedules because we do not think money should ever stand in the way of your health care.
